description: Crashes lots without reason. Just says system issue please report yada yada. No matter how many months I've waited it kept going. System report informs this is the software with the issue. byeee

After paying for synergy, having it refunded, waiting a few years, then trying again with the new version. All I can say is I've never been anything but immediately disappointed with this product. It has never once run as advertised or expected, constantly lagging, not transferring mouse clicks, sending repeated keystrokes, or just crashing altogether.
summary: Locks up, lags, or crashes constantly

description:
I've been using Synergy for many years. I think I first paid for the product back in 2014, but had already been using it for free for several years before that.

I am a software engineer and often use two computer systems with Synergy running between them. This has always been a great tool for me. I have highly recommended it to other developers on many occasions over the years.

I can understand people thinking this software doesn't work, it does require a solid network connection, so if you're working with a $40 wifi router with 30 devices on it, yeah, latency and connectivity is going to be a problem. I run all my pc's on a wired network, 1 pc, 2 linux boxes, 1 mac book pro, all tied together for a seemless experiance.

I attempted to share the mouse and keyboard from my server OS (Arch) to my laptop (Windows). While the synergy client (Windows) could connect to the server (Arch) as evidenced by the log messages, the keyboard and mouse could not be shared regardless of the monitor configuration in the server settings.
Share 1 mouse and keyboard to many computers
it does not save the server address to connect to so need to type it each time
latest OS update solved all the problem

Synergy is incompatible with Wayland, which is enabled by default on F33. Edit /etc/gdm/custom.conf to have it contain the line

WaylandEnable = false

Reboot and enjoy.
summary: Will not work out of the box on F33, but workaround is easy
